DOC.brief_summary: What is the effect of two common tourniquet techniques on the first attempt success rate of peripheral intravenous cannulation?
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Two Different Tourniquet Techniques on Peripheral IV Access Success Rates
DOC.criteria: Emergency Department patients 18 years old or older who receive peripheral IV access Patients under the age of 18 prison inmates pregnant patients patients who are unable to give informed consent critically ill patients who need emergent IV access as defined by the Emergency Medicine consultant of record for the patient
